paintings.title: The surrender of Breda
paintings.description: The siege of Breda of 1624–1625 occurred during the Eighty Years' War and was carried out by the Army of Flanders. The siege resulted in the fortified city of Breda passing from the control of the Dutch Republic to that of the Habsburg Netherlands.

paintings.title: Dutch Ships Ramming Spanish Galleys off the Flemish Coast in October 1602
paintings.description: An imposing Dutch ship under full sail, proudly flying the Dutch tricolour and the flag of the States-General, runs down two Spanish galley. Depicted is a naval engagement, the Battle of the Dover Straits, which had unfolded in the Channel on 3 October 1602.

paintings.title: The Death of Major Peirson
paintings.description: The death of Major Francis Peirson at the Battle of Jersey on 6 January 1781, part of the Anglo-French War (1778–1783).
paintings.Location: Jersey Museum and Art Gallery, Jersey

paintings.title: The Charging Chasseur
paintings.description: Mounted Napoleonic cavalry officer who is ready to attack.

paintings.title: The Battle of Grunwald
paintings.description: The Battle of Grunwald, the victory of the allied Crown of the Kingdom of Poland and Grand Duchy of Lithuania over the Teutonic Order in 1410.

paintings.title: Battle of Çeşme at Night
paintings.description: Chesme battle in the night of June 25-26, 1770

paintings.title: Stormtroopers Advancing under Gas
paintings.description: The engraving represents five German stormtroopers, recognizable by their steel helmets, all wearing gas masks, as they are advancing into enemy lines, while suffering a gas attack.

paintings.title: The Portrait of a Sergeant
paintings.description: Artist portraying a sergeant during Napoleonic Wars

paintings.title: Campagne de France
paintings.description: Napoleon and his staff are retuning from Soissons after the battle of Laon.

paintings.title: Scotland Forever!
paintings.description: The start of the cavalry charge of the Royal Scots Greys who charged alongside the British heavy cavalry at the Battle of Waterloo in 1815 during the Napoleonic wars.

paintings.title: Vuelvan Caras at the Battle of Las Queseras del Medio
paintings.description: The Battle of Las Quesaras del Medio was a crucial battle in the Venezuelan War of Independence.

paintings.title: Rocroi, el último tercio
paintings.description: The Battle of Rocroi (1643), a decisive clash between the Spanish and French armies, notable as one of the last stands of the legendary Spanish “tercios” (infantry units).

paintings.title: The Last Stand of the 44th Regiment at Gundamuck, 1842.
paintings.description: The final defense of the surviving soldiers of Her Majesty’s 44th Regiment at Gandamak in 1842.

paintings.title: The Battle of Alexander at Issus
paintings.description: The painting portrays the 333 BC Battle of Issus, in which Alexander the Great secured a decisive victory over Darius III of Persia and gained crucial leverage in his campaign against the Persian Empire.

paintings.title: The Revolt of Cairo
paintings.description: The Revolt of Cairo that took place on 21 October 1798 during the French Invasion of Egypt under General Napoleon Bonaparte.

paintings.title: Washington Crossing the Delaware
paintings.description: General George Washington's crossing of the Delaware River with the Continental Army on the night of December 25–26, 1776, during the American Revolutionary War
paintings.Location: Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York,

paintings.title: Carica di Lancieri
paintings.description: The dramatic moment of a cavalry charge during wartime.

paintings.title: The Death of General Wolfe
paintings.description: Commemorating the 1759 Battle of Quebec, where General James Wolfe died at the moment of victory.

paintings.title: The Battle of La Hogue
paintings.description: Fought off the coast of Normandy the battle was decisive victory for the Royal Navy and its Dutch allies, thwarting an expected French invasion of England.

paintings.title: The Battle of Quiberon Bay,
paintings.description: The Battle of Quiberon Bay, on 20 November 1759, was the most decisive naval encounter during the Seven Years War, 1756-63, a conflict involving the major European colonial powers and fought around the globe.

paintings.title: Edward III Crossing The Somme
paintings.description: The scene shows a mounted Edward III leading his army across the River Somme in Northern France shortly before the Battle of Crécy in 1346 during the Hundred Years War.

paintings.title: The Last Grenadier of Waterloo
paintings.description: A last grenadier on the battlefield of Waterloo, 1815.

paintings.title: The Battle of Jena
paintings.description: It depicts the Battle of Jena fought on 14 October 1806. It portrays the French Emperor Napoleon on the field at Jena, one of his greatest victories during the Napoleonic Wars where he routed a Prussian force.

paintings.title: Battle of Moscow, 7th September 1812
paintings.description: Louis-François Lejeune's painting of the Battle of Borodino, also known as the Battle of the Moskva, is a masterpiece created by the artist-general who fought in the battle.

paintings.title: Lannes' death at Essling
paintings.description: Lannes mortally wounded at Essling.

paintings.title: The Battle of Eylau
paintings.description: The painting shows a dramatic cavalry charge during the Battle of Eylau in 1807, fought in a snowy landscape.

paintings.title: Grenadier Leontiy Korennoy
paintings.description: Feat of the grenadier Leontiy Korennoy of the Leib‑Guards Finnish Regiment during the 1813 Battle of Leipzig.

paintings.title: Cavalry and Tanks at Arras, 1918
paintings.description: Tanks and cavalry during the advance near Arras in 1918.

paintings.title: French infantrymen
paintings.description: French troops charging a German trench during World War I. In the background, soldiers advance equipped for assault, while in the foreground, two French infantrymen prepare to strike Germans below with bayonets.

paintings.title: Retreat from Moscow
paintings.description: Marshall Ney supporting the Rear Guard During the Retreat from Moscow.

paintings.title: Body of General Abel Douay
paintings.description: Crown Prince Friedrich Wilhelm on the body of General Abel Douay, Weissenburg on the 4th August 1870.

paintings.title: That Two-Thousand Yard Stare
paintings.description: An exhausted U.S. Marine with a vacant, distant gaze that symbolizes combat stress and psychological trauma.
paintings.Location: Fort Lesley J. McNair, Washington DC

paintings.title: Ligny
paintings.description: This is a representation of the Battle of Ligny in 1815, showing Napoleon surrounded by his staff surveying the battlefield while columns of infantry advance to the front.

paintings.title: Death as general rides a horse on a battlefield
paintings.description: The watercolour shows Death personified as a military general riding a horse across a chaotic battlefield, surrounded by smoke, fallen soldiers, and the ruins of war.

paintings.title: Death as general rides a horse on a battlefield
paintings.description: The watercolour shows Death personified as a military general riding a horse across a chaotic battlefield, surrounded by smoke, fallen soldiers, and the ruins of war.

paintings.title: Reply of the Zaporozhian Cossacks
paintings.description: Based on the legend of Cossacks sending an insulting reply to an ultimatum from the Sultan of the Ottoman Empire, Mehmed IV.

paintings.title: Twas A Famous Victory
paintings.description: An elderly veteran stands in front of two boys inside a museum, pointing to the painting depicting the Battle of Trafalgar in which he participated.

paintings.title: Sortie de la garnison de Huningue
paintings.description: famous painting and print depicting the honorable exit of the French garrison from Huningue after its capitulation in 1815, showing the French general and his contingent parading in front of the Allied troops, symbolizing courage and military discipline despite defeat, a work that captures the historical moment and French military pride.

paintings.title: Battle of Bunker Hill
paintings.description: A British force conquering the hill

paintings.title: Closing the Gates at Hougoumont
paintings.description: Coldstream Guards closing the gates of Hougoumont Farm to the advancing French during the Battle of Waterloo.
